data.title: Norfolk General District Court
data.text:
4th Judicial District of Virginia

Fax: Civil Fax: (757) 962-3989

Fax: Criminal Fax: (757) 640-8320

Fax: Traffic Fax: (757) 640-8319

Clerk's Office Hours

8:00 AM - 4:00 PM

Address

150 Saint Paul's Blvd, Room 3202

Norfolk, VA 23510-2747

Judges

Hon. Leondras J. Webster, Chief Judge

Hon. Robert Lamar Foley

Hon. Erikka Monet Massie

Hon. Joseph W. Myers

Hon. Michael C. Rosenblum

Hon. Tameeka M. Williams

Court Schedule

Civil Cases Mon. - Fri. Court 2A (A-M) Court 2D (N-Z) Small Claims Cases 10:00 a.m. (Court 1B) Criminal Cases (2B & 2C) Mon-Fri., 9:00 a.m., 10:00 a.m. &11:00 a.m. Alcoholic and Beverage Control Cases (2C) 1st Tues. & 1st Thurs., 9:00 a.m. Revocation Hearings Thurs., 10:00 a.m. (2B) Fri., 10:00 a.m. (2C) Animal Control/Fishing Violations (2B) Fri., 10:00 a.m. Environmental Cases, Health, Housing & Zoning Violations (2B) Tues/Fri., 9:00 a.m. Traffic Cases (1A) Mon. - Fri., 9:00 a.m., 10:00 a.m., & 11:00 a.m. In Custody Criminal/Traffic Arraignments, 8:30 a.m. Out of Custody Criminal Arraignments, 9:00 a.m. Out of Custody Traffic Arraignments, 11:30 a.m. All Bond Hearings are held at 10:30 a.m.

Continuance Policy

Criminal case continuances require review by judge and approval upon good cause only. Traffic case continuances for first time appearances may be granted by clerk's office when on summons only with good cause. Civil case continuances may be granted by the clerk's office when consented to by all parties for good cause shown, up to & including the second continuance request. Any further continuance requests shall be decided by the Court. All such requests shall be in writing.
